channel.title: What would you like to do?
channel.description:
When I've left school I'm not really sure what I want to do, and lately I've been thinking about it A LOT for some reason. I want to go into the R.A.A.F, graphic game designer, act (just because i love being the person to put on a voice and act serious and all that stuff) or become an artist.
I've not really decided and by the looks of it my best option is the R.A.A.F, but it's just a thought I've been having. What would you like to do (if you have options) when you're out of school?
I'm not sure if this topic has been made before. :)

item.title: What would you like to do?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:20, topic:431327”]pharmacist or radiologist both pay good amount

That sounds like a good idea, don’t you love helping the elderly?

The ones that don’t bitch about the new times. I like old ones with meaningless stories.
Also, this. http://www1.salary.com/Pharmacist-Salary.html
However I’ve been looking into the medical field since a young age, I just find chemical effects on the body rather interesting and their general manipulations to improve health and well being.

you read my mind with pharmacist[/quote]

So much in common
Also, use this on your resumé: “Alchemy level in skyrim: 100. Herblore level in rs: 99.”
But in all seriousness I have been looking into that for awhile. When it comes to the human body, there are some things I can and can’t stand. Blood and organs I’ve gained an immunity to, but anything like excessive zit/pimple popping (see Tosh.0) I just can’t stand. Pharmaceutical work is best though because you’re not directly dealing with any of that. The creation of drugs has always interest me, and since a young age I’ve always admired those who are looked up to today for their major breakthroughs in science.

Read full topic
item.source: What would you like to do?

item.title: What would you like to do?
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:2, topic:431327”]As dumb as I may sound. I don’t want to go into anything specific, but to be lucky enough to have a job to support a wife and (gf wants 5 kids?!?!) kids. As long as I am lucky enough to have all of that then I will be happy lol.

Best of luck getting into any of those, they will all require some hard work and dedication.[/quote]
5 kids? It’s a very good life by the sounds of it, having a family to support and love you. I wish you the best.

RiiPiiNFtW:

Main goal is to major in Wildlife Biology and minor in Computer Science.

That’s… A lot of work there, like a lot. Good luck.

Read full topic
